intro: Helianthopsis acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-leaved helianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry climates. Its leaves are narrow and sharply pointed, giving it its common name. Helianthopsis acuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
